questions.question: India has _______ UNESCO World Heritage Sites.
_______ UNESCO sites in India are designated for cultural importance.
_______ of India's UNESCO sites are recognized for natural beauty.
_______ National Park is praised for its blend of culture and nature.
Diamond was first discovered and mined in _______.
In Sanskrit, diamond was addressed as '_______' meaning thunderbolt.
Diamond was also called '_______' - warrior god Indra's weapon.
Early descriptions of diamond date back to the _______ century BC.
India is the world's largest producer and exporter of _______.
Auroville was founded in _______.
Auroville is situated mostly in _______.
Indian Postal Service has _______ post offices.
The largest number of _______ in the world are found in India.
_______ out of 10 of the world's highest peaks are in the Himalayas.
India is the only country with a Bill of Rights for _______.
The Golden Temple serves vegetarian meals to over _______ people a day.
_______ is the world's highest battlefield.
_______ is the world's second largest coldest inhabited place.
The seven states in Northeast India are collectively called the _______.
Centuries-old barter system is still practised at _______ Mela, Assam.
_______/Muga silk is not produced anywhere else in the world other than Assam.
_______ is the world's only women-run market located in Manipur.
_______ National Park is the world's only floating national park in Manipur.
At _______ village in Nagaland, one can be in India and Myanmar simultaneously.
In Nagaland alone, there are _______ tribes and 36 languages.
'Mi' means people, 'zo' means hills, 'ram' means country - hence _______ means country of people living in hills.

'Slash and Burn' or _______ cultivation is common in Mizoram.
_______ is the only floating palace in Northeast, located in Tripura.
_______ village in Arunachal Pradesh is the first place in India to receive the sun's first ray after Japan.
The _______ Monastery in Tawang is the largest monastery in India.
Tawang Monastery is _______ years old.
Meghalaya is the only state where _______ bridges are made.
_______ in Meghalaya is the rainiest place in the world.
Mawsynram receives _______ inches of rain per year.
_______ was the first Woman President of UN General Assembly.
_______ was the first tribal woman to become President of India.
_______ was India's first Woman Ambassador.
_______ was the first Woman Air Vice Marshal of India.
_______ was the first Woman Judge in Supreme Court of India.
_______ was the first Woman Lieutenant General of India.
_______ was the first Indian Woman to scale all seven continental peaks.
_______ was the first Indian woman to ride a motorbike from Kanyakumari to Kashmir.
Ahmedabad is called the _______ of India.
Ahmedabad was founded by Sultan Ahmad Shah in _______.
Lucknow is called the City of _______.
Lucknow is located on the banks of river _______.
Kerala is called the Land of _______.
Jammu and Kashmir is called the _______ of India.
Mumbai is called the City of _______ Islands.

_______ is the hometown of famous writer Ruskin Bond.

Batalla de Flores marks the end of _______ month in Valencia, Spain.
Chiang Mai Flower Festival is held on the first weekend of _______.
Feria de las Flores in Medellin, Columbia symbolises the end of _______.
The Rose Parade in Pasadena, California is organized on every _______ Day.
The Genzano Infiorata Flower Festival has been taking place since _______.
_______ is the National Dress for Brunei and Malaysia.
_______ is worn by women of Germany, Austria, Switzerland and Liechtenstein.
_______ is worn by Flamenco dancers in Spain.
_______ is formal clothing worn during festivals in Hawaii.
_______ is a long T-shaped dress worn by Japanese.
_______ is a Vietnamese costume made of silk.
Cheongsam is also known as _______ gown.
_______ is a tube-like skirt worn by women in Laos and Thailand.
Chami Murmu is an environmental activist from _______ district of Jharkhand.
Chami Murmu set up her organisation called '_______'.
Chami Murmu received the Padma Shri award in _______.

Dukhu Majhi, at age _______, continues to plant trees.
Anirudh Rao won first place in the International Young _______ awards.
Anirudh Rao's tornado warning prototype is called '_______'.

Kiara Kaur started her environmental journey at age _______.

Sahithi Radha created _______, an electronic waste recycling initiative.
Veer Mehta created '_______ the Tide' for marine conservation.
Over _______% of waste is recyclable.
We only recycle about _______% of waste.
An aluminum can can return to shop floor in _______ weeks after recycling.

_______ Festival had 660 million people gathering for a holy dip in Ganga.

_______ created an artificial Sun.

Justice _______ is the new Chief Justice of India.

_______/3 of the normal tooth is below the gumline.
